data.title: Allow scaling of collision shapes and rigid bodies for easier subscene management
data.body:
Sometimes you implement full part of scene in a subscene, including collision objects and rigid bodies,
for easier testing, then you need to integrate this part into the whole main scene, which requires scaling. With current approach you have to split the resulting scene into physics/collision objects and
visual objects and integrate these separately, actually recreating physics/collision part. There should be
some mechanism for making this less tedious task.

In file included from scene/register_scene_types.cpp:89:0:
./scene/2d/back_buffer_copy.h: At global scope:
./scene/2d/back_buffer_copy.h:33:8: error: extra qualification 'BackBufferCopy::' on member 'get_item_rect' [-fpermissive]
  Rect2 BackBufferCopy::get_item_rect() const;
        ^
scons: **\* [scene/register_scene_types.x11.tools.64.o] Error 1
scons: building terminated because of errors.

data.title: Detect multiple monitors using Xinerama extension for fullscreen
data.body:
This change includes the Xinerama extension and queries it when going
fullscreen. Xinerama has information about the actual monitors
connected in a multi-monitor configuration. X normally treats both
monitors as a single large screen. Xinerama allows us to get the
actual dimensions of attached screens. Nvidia TwinView and other
drivers use the Xinerama protocol so this should be compatible with
most multi-screen setups.

This forces fullscreen to always go to screen 0. This fixes #1408.
This also fixes the issue in some window managers (e.g. LXDE and
OpenBox) where Godot would stretch across both monitors.

data.title: Fix compie error in TileMap::_fix_cell_transform(...)
data.body:
- offset should be constant reference
- update naming of parameters to follow "p_" naming convention

data.title: Creation of the car. Bugs and many other things
data.body:
Today I decided to be engaged in project development. I am familiar with Godot from first week of its birth (spring 2014). 
Looking at a demo I started replenishing gradually the project models. Everything went rather well. 
Oh well! prehistory will be enough!
Here to you directly list:

**To add:**
1. The script of your car can gather fighter speeds, but for some reason can't go back. At me (for my purposes) everything was solved very simply. I wouldn't want that other people got on so low-quality demo. If you not against, I can make the new version of a demo of the car.

**Bugs:**
1. Where without bugs. We will begin with the most ancient and long ago moss-grown. Tremesh collider still doesn't work. To what it is connected I don't know. If I would know at the time of prerelease 1.0stable that this bug lives still, I not simply would write here, but also on mail and to personal messages in facebook. For example my route perfectly works with a similar collision, but it is impossible to use it on the car.
2. One more old bug (itself I came across it and even I wrote about it is mute at a forum). Convex collider very strongly loads system if to deliver it child to the car. In case of collisions my notebook starts being buggy very strongly. Also I ask to correct. Of course I don't give a demo, but I think you and you will be able to check it.

**To correct:**
1. I stayed some months on Unity3D and returned back to Godot only because I was enticed by physics of the car. Today I stayed the whole day behind the project and the working prototype of behavior of the car tried to make. I almost managed it. The first that to me was evident it twitching of a wheel (as in the same Unity), but also sharp response of the car to all these actions isn't simple.
2. And again physics of the car. It not especially hinders, but the realism and ideas of friction kills at all. If to go on the car along a wall, the car sharp breakthrough turns approximately on 10-15 degrees to the opposite side from a wall. I Predlogat also to reconsider this slice of a code of physics.
3. Third point and... (what?) Of course I will speak again about a car physics nedodelannost. In settings of a wheel there are ticks which are responsible for characteristics of a wheel (turn and pull). My car falls to the ground and jumps up on back wheels (it normally. settings such) but if to click gas, the machine will go., It seems, anything surprising as the machine concerns back wheels of the earth. All problem that on back wheels the tick "pull" isn't necessary... Having a little thought I came to a conclusion that the car receives force not on wheels, and on a cabin. I would like to see impact of physics on wheels.
4. "Fig. One more point. Likely again about car physics!". Absolutely truly! Again point about dirty linen! It could be carried in the section "Add", but it is rather a defect which can't be corrected without correction of point 3. The essence of this "bug feature" is that the car, crashing into a hindrance doesn't go any more and wheels aren't twisted soovetstvenno. Everything is seemingly normal, on as opportunities "To burn down tires", "to start with a place, reserving a trace"? all this can be made, but what sense if the wheel isn't twisted?

**Inference:**
I bring the apologies for inexact names. The text is translated by means of the site as I very badly know English.
It would be desirable to hear your judgement and a sentence concerning a car demo.

data.title: pass giving ; or <NewLine> required errors at end of file
data.body:
When putting the following code in a script, at the end of a file without an empty newline give the following parser error:

error(line, 1)Expected ';' or <NewLine>.

```
func _do_something():
    pass
```

Replacing the pass with a return, or adding a new line after pass solved the problem. I inquired in IRC, and I recon this to be a parsing bug.

Running OsX 10.9.5, and using the latest git code (at the date of writing this).

Screenshot attached to see the problem at hand with my current script.
![screen shot 2015-03-08 at 11 38 20](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/10252874/6545439/bf8830b8-c587-11e4-9378-849a65bb93af.png)

data.title: X11 window management
data.body:
This PR will add the following methods to the OS singleton like discussed in the [developers mailing list](https://groups.google.com/d/topic/godot-engine/FWEx-YPbOHc/discussion):
## Screen:
- int OS.get_screen_count()
- int OS.get_screen()
- void OS.set_screen(int screen)
- Vector2 OS.get_screen_position(int screen=0)
- Vector2 OS.get_screen_size(int screen=0)
## Window positioning and sizing:
- Vector2 OS.get_window_position()
- void OS.set_window_position(Vector2 position)
- Vector2 OS.get_window_size()
- void OS.set_window_size(Vector2 size)
## Window states:
- void OS.set_fullscreen(bool enabled)
- bool OS.is_fullscreen()
- void OS.set_maximized(bool enabled)
- bool OS.is_maximized()
- void OS.set_minimized(bool enabled)
- bool OS.is_minimized()
- void OS.set_resizable(bool enabled)
- bool OS.is_resizeable()
## Compiling

`scons p=x11 new_wm_api=yes`
## Demo

The PR also includes the window_management demo. It can be used as test case for the different x11 desktop environments and also as an implementation test for other platforms(OSX + Windows):
![window_management_demo](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1824607/6545084/51062c02-c542-11e4-9d35-009e0b1d5e95.png)

If some methods are not implemented, the demo will show a warning on startup:
![window_management_demo_missing_methods](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/1824607/6545113/dfc0ec38-c543-11e4-9066-d2073159e9b0.png)
## Note

This PR will only work on the x11 platform(Linux). When you try to compile it on other platforms, compilation will stop with an error. Hopefully this will change in the future. It is just a starting point for a new wm api.

Linux/X11 folks, please test^3 it =)

data.title: add view param to canvas_render_items
data.body: Submitting from IRC disucussion - hopefully this makes sense.  In talking about accessing the view and model matrices separately in shaders, reduz suggested that canvas_render_items could be given an additional parameter for view.

data.title: Array comparison is not working as expected
data.body:
There seems to be something wrong with array comparison in GDScript, as shown by this example:

```
var test = [1, 2]
var test2 = test
print(test == test)
print(test == test2)
print(test == [1, 2])
```

The output is:

```
True
False
False
```

when all tests should be true.

data.title: Godot Windows-Binaries don't run on WinXP
data.body:
As I have seen in an Virtual Machine with XP, the Godot Windows binaries don't run there. On Windows 7 and up they do.
The support of WinXP ends on April 2014, but I think, there are still a lot of XP-machines out there, so it would be make sense to support them with Godot.

data.title: 3D rotation around the Y axis is stuck in [-90;90], other components being adjusted to make up for it
data.body:
Hello. Not correct receive object orientation on Y axis in 3D mode.
obj_rot_y = get_node('test_cube').get_global_transform().basis.get_euler().y
If the object is rotated more or less than 90 degrees to the transformation of adjacent axes and thus takes the opposite effect on the axle.
This problem is only with the axis Y in 3D.
Godot v.1.0
